# addProgressMark(_:)

**Instance Method**

Adds the progress mark to the receiver.

## Declaration

```swift
func addProgressMark(_ progressMark: NSAnimation.Progress)
```

## Parameters

- **progressMark**: A `float` value (typed as NSAnimationProgress) between 0.0 and 1.0. Values outside that range are pinned to 0.0 or 1.0, whichever is nearest.

## Discussion

A progress mark represents a percentage of the animation completed. When the animation reaches a progress mark, an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimationDelegate/animation(_:didReachProgressMark:)] message is sent to the delegate and an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/progressMarkNotification] is broadcast to all observers. You might receive multiple notifications of progress advances over multiple marks.

## Related Documentation

- **currentProgress**: The current progress of the animation.

## Managing Progress Marks

- **removeProgressMark(_:)**: Removes progress mark from the receiver.
- **progressMarks**: An array of floating-point numbers representing current progress marks.
